org.fit.cssbox.layout
Class Box

java.lang.Object
  org.fit.cssbox.layout.Box
Direct Known Subclasses:
ElementBox, TextBox
public abstract class Box
extends java.lang.Object

A visual formatting box. It can be of two types: an inline box or a block box.

Author:
radek

g - current graphics context
ctx - current visual context
Method Detail

copyValues

public void copyValues(Box src)
Copy all the values from another box

Parameters:
src - source box

createBoxTree

public static Box createBoxTree(org.w3c.dom.Node n,
                                java.awt.Graphics g,
                                VisualContext ctx,
                                DOMAnalyzer decoder,
                                java.net.URL baseurl,
                                BlockBox contbox,
                                BlockBox absbox,
                                ElementBox parent)
Creates a box tree from a DOM node. Recursively creates the child boxes from the child nodes. If the element is inline, we try to create an inline box. When a block box occures inside, everything is converted to blocks.

Parameters:
n - DOM tree root node
g - graphics context to render on
ctx - visual context to render on
decoder - a CSS style decoder
contbox - the containing box of the new box when not absolutly positioned
absbox - the containing box of the new box when absolutly positioned
Returns:
the root node of the created tree of boxes

createBox

public static ElementBox createBox(org.w3c.dom.Element n,
                                   java.awt.Graphics g,
                                   VisualContext ctx,
                                   DOMAnalyzer decoder,
                                   java.net.URL baseurl,
                                   ElementBox parent)
Creates a new box from an element.

Parameters:
n - The source DOM element
g - Graphics context
ctx - Visual context
decoder - The CSS style analyzer
baseurl - The base URL of the document
Returns:
A new box of a subclass of ElementBox based on the value of the 'display' CSS property

isBlock

public boolean isBlock()
Check if this is an inline.

Returns:
false if this is an inline box and it contains inline boxes only, true otherwise.

isEmpty

public boolean isEmpty()
Returns:
true, if this element contains no visible non-empty elements

isDisplayed

public boolean isDisplayed()
Returns:
true, if this element has the 'display' property different from 'none'

isVisible

public boolean isVisible()
Returns:
true if the element is at least partially located in the visible area, that means its x and y coordinates are above zero.

isWhitespace

public abstract boolean isWhitespace()
Returns:
true if the box only contains whitespaces

canSplitInside

public abstract boolean canSplitInside()
Returns:
true if the box can be split in two or more boxes on different lines

canSplitBefore

public abstract boolean canSplitBefore()
Returns:
true if there can be a linebreak before this element on different lines

canSplitAfter

public abstract boolean canSplitAfter()
Returns:
true if there can be a linebreak after this element on different lines

moveRight

public void moveRight(int ofs)
Move the box to the right.

Parameters:
ofs - distance in pixels - positive numbers move to the right, negative to the left

Move the box down.

public abstract boolean hasFixedWidth()
Returns:
true if the width of the box is either explicitely set or it can be computed from the parent box

Returns:

Returns:
true, if the box contains any in-flow boxes

Returns:
true, if the element displays at least something (some content, or borders)

doLayout

public abstract boolean doLayout(int availw,
                                 boolean force,
                                 boolean linestart)
Compute the width and height of this element. Layout the sub-elements.

Parameters:
availw - Maximal width available to the child elements
force - Use the area even if the used width is greater than maxwidth
linestart - Indicates whether the element is placed at the line start
Returns:
True if the box has been succesfully placed

parent - Parent element box.

draw

public abstract void draw(java.awt.Graphics g,
                          int turn,
                          int mode)
Draw the specified stage (DRAW_*)

Parameters:
g - graphics context to draw on
turn - drawing stage - DRAW_ALL, DRAW_FLOAT or DRAW_NONFLOAT
mode - what to draw - DRAW_FG, DRAW_BG or DRAW_BOTH
